dublin_core.dcvalue: Orthogonal polarization spectral OPS imaging is an optical imaging technique that uses a handheld microscope and green polarized light to visualize the red blood cells in the microcirculation of organ surfaces The purpose of this study was to evaluate whether OPS imaging can be used for the functional and morphological evaluation of microcirculation in the conjunctiva
Graefe's archive for clinical and experimental ophthalmology = Albrecht von Graefes Archiv fur klinische und experimentelle Ophthalmologie
Orthogonal polarization spectral imaging of conjunctival microcirculation.
